alert.note: Alert for Grant (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 12:08AM MDT until August 24 at 3:16AM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM MDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest New Mexico, including Grant and Sierra Counties. * WHEN...Until 315 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Flooding will primarily affect the west slopes of the Black Fire burn scar along Black Canyon, as well as portions of the upper Gila River near Gila Hot Springs. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Gila Hot Springs and Copperas Vista. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
